intro: Galium prusense, commonly known as Prussian bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. Galium prusense thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
